definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91

sentences.english: Culinarily , sashimi represents the Japanese cultural appreciation of subtlety.
sentences.chinese: 从烹饪上说，生鱼片代表了日本的精明文化价值观。

sentences.english: The crabmeat and sashimi are so fresh and juicy that you'd no doubt want to order more.
sentences.chinese: 螃蟹肉和生鱼片新鲜且多汁，你当然希望多多益善了。

sentences.english: Small rice balls with fish, shellfish, etc. on top.
sentences.chinese: 握寿司顶部盖有生鱼片的小饭团。

sentences.english: I like to have sashimi and sushi with wasabi. That makes the taste delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢吃芥末的生鱼片和寿司，那使口味美味。

sentences.english: Research has found this group is more likely to eat raw fish or raw shellfish, Weis tells WebMD.
sentences.chinese: 研究发现，这组群体更可能食用到生鱼片或生贝类。

sentences.english: Avoid raw fish, especially shellfish like oysters and clams.
sentences.chinese: 避免生鱼片，尤其是贝类水生物如牡蛎和蛤蚌。

sentences.english: So he goes down with the ship sashimi-style.
sentences.chinese: 因此他和他的船就以生鱼片刺身的形式往下去了。

sentences.english: Hikari Sushi Bar serves freshly made sushi and sashimi among other Japanese specialties.
sentences.chinese: 光寿司酒吧供应新鲜的寿司和生鱼片等日本特产之一。

sentences.english: Sushi, Nigiri, Maki & Sashimi with traditional garnishes.
sentences.chinese: 寿司，握寿司，手卷，生鱼片与传统腌酱菜。

sentences.english: Hyeon-sook operates a small sashimi restaurant and a bed and breakfast to make a living on the island.
sentences.chinese: 贤淑经营一个小的生鱼片餐厅和床和早餐在岛上谋生。

sentences.english: Want to know how to make Sashimi but don't know where to start?
sentences.chinese: 想要知道如何做生鱼片，但不知道从何下手？

definition: tempura/deep-fried cooking/also called 甜不辣[tian2 bu4 la4]
Japanese cuisine (abbr. for 日本料理[Ri4 ben3 liao4 li3])
